Preface to Sending Dharma Master Zhen Back to Mount Lu Preface to Sending Dharma Master Zhen Back to Mount Lu I left Xunyang five years ago, and Dharma Master Zhen came from Mount Lu to meet me in Qiantang.
Hearing that he had arrived, I was both happy and surprised.
The master did not care about the position he obtained from the prime minister.
He shook off his robes and entered the mountains.
He vowed to spend the rest of his life there, not stepping into the secular realm.
Why did he come here?
When we talked together,
I only then knew that he was planning to build a Buddhist stupa, not to change his mind because of ordinary matters.
When I was in Xunyang, I once discussed people with Zhou Shuzhi.
I considered the master to be pure and clear, able to instruct students with his Way.
Shuzhi highly recommended him with weighty words.
Therefore, he and I, along with Guo Shubao and Pei Changyan, several times visited his door.
We took turns composing songs and poems to praise his virtues.
The master was also delighted to reciprocate their virtues.
Now, traveling thousands of miles,
he meets them again, staying for nearly half a year.
The more I received his words, the more I wrote about his way, the closer it became.
The understanding of the meaning was a hundred times more sincere than at first.
In the eighth month of autumn, Master Zhen gathered his belongings and boarded a boat, intending to leave.
The people of Hangzhou respected and admired him, bowed their heads, and earnestly requested him to stay.
